translated: The ministers had the sound of a bell proclaimed in the royal palace:

original: gang dag 'phags pa rnams kyi zham ring pa yin pa de dag rgyal po'i khab kyi phyi rol dang / 'od ma'i tshal gyi phyi rol gyi bar du 'dug par chad kyis deng la der sdum pa rtsigs shig ces bsgo nas /
analyzed: gang dag 'phags pa rnams kyi zham ring pa yin pa de dag rgyal po'i khab kyi phyi rol dang / 'od ma'i tshal gyi phyi rol gyi bar du 'dug par chad kyis deng la der sdum pa rtsigs shig ces bsgo nas /
translated: Those who are attendants of the noble ones should go and live between the outskirts of the royal palace and the outskirts of the Bamboo Grove. Build a house there.

original: de dag der dong ste sdum pa brtsigs so //
analyzed: de dag der dong ste sdum pa brtsigs so //
translated: They went there and built a house.

original: lha 'bangs kyi sdum pa brtsigs nas de dag gtsug lag khang du dong ste las byed cing /
analyzed: lha 'bangs kyi sdum pa brtsigs nas de dag gtsug lag khang du dong ste las byed cing /
translated: After building the house for Devaputra, they went to the monastery and worked.

original: dge slong rnams kyis de dag la las 'di ni rung ba yin gyis khyed kyis bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis de dag la las 'di ni rung ba yin gyis khyed kyis bya'o //
translated: The monks taught them, “This is proper; you should do it.

original: 'di ni rung ba ma yin gyis khyed kyis mi bya'o zhes las bstan nas /
analyzed: 'di ni rung ba ma yin gyis khyed kyis mi bya'o zhes las bstan nas /
translated: This is improper; you should not do it.”

original: de dag las rung ba byed pas /
analyzed: de dag las rung ba byed pas /
translated: They did what was proper.

original: lha 'bangs lha 'bangs zhes bya ba'i ming du gyur to //
analyzed: lha 'bangs lha 'bangs zhes bya ba'i ming du gyur to //
translated: They were called “devout” (devaputra).

original: dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra ba skyong bar byed pas /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra ba skyong bar byed pas /
translated: They guarded the Saṅgha’s pleasure grove.

original: rtse rgod rtse rgod ces bya ba'i ming du gyur to //
analyzed: rtse rgod rtse rgod ces bya ba'i ming du gyur to //
translated: They were called “playful” (kīlarāja).

original: de dag thams cad gtsug lag khang du 'jug pas klag cor gyi sgras dge slong dag gis sems rtse gcig pa nyid mi 'grub nas /
analyzed: de dag thams cad gtsug lag khang du 'jug pas klag cor gyi sgras dge slong dag gis sems rtse gcig pa nyid mi 'grub nas /
translated: All of them entered the monastery. The noise of their shouting prevented the monks from achieving one-pointedness of mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @145b pa; ji snyed dag gis las 'grub pa de snyed 'jug par bya'i thams cad mi bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @145b pa; ji snyed dag gis las 'grub pa de snyed 'jug par bya'i thams cad mi bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, “As many as are needed to complete the work may enter; all should not go.”

original: dge slong dag gis de dag thams cad la zas dang gos sbyin par byed nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag gis de dag thams cad la zas dang gos sbyin par byed nas /
translated: The monks gave food and clothing to all of them.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; gang dag las byed pa de dag la zas dang gos sbyin par bya'i //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; gang dag las byed pa de dag la zas dang gos sbyin par bya'i //
translated: The Blessed One said, “You should give food and clothing to those who do the work.

original: thams cad la mi bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad la mi bya'o //
translated: But not to everyone.”

original: dge slong rnams kyis de dag na ba yal bar bor nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis de dag na ba yal bar bor nas /
translated: The monks neglected the sick.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gang dag na ba de dag la zas dang gos sbyin par bya zhing bsnyen bkur yang bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag na ba de dag la zas dang gos sbyin par bya zhing bsnyen bkur yang bya'o //
translated: “You should give food and clothing to the sick and also serve them.”

original: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na /
analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na /
translated: Later,

original: nye dga' dge skos byed pas des lha 'bangs de dag la smras pa /
analyzed: nye dga' dge skos byed pas des lha 'bangs de dag la smras pa /
translated: Upāli was the assigner of duties. He said to the gods,

original: bzhin bzang dag kho bo dge skos byed kyis khyed cag nang par sngar shog cig /
analyzed: bzhin bzang dag kho bo dge skos byed kyis khyed cag nang par sngar shog cig /
translated: “Sirs, I am the assigner of duties. You must come in the morning.”

original: rgyal po'i khab na ston zla tha chung gi g-yon can zhes bya ba chom rkun pa dag gi kun tu spyod pa ni de dag dgag dbye byas ma thag tu shes ldan dag bdag cag gis las ci zhig byas na des brtsal mi dgos par lo bskor du
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab na ston zla tha chung gi g-yon can zhes bya ba chom rkun pa dag gi kun tu spyod pa ni de dag dgag dbye byas ma thag tu shes ldan dag bdag cag gis las ci zhig byas na des brtsal mi dgos par lo bskor du
translated: “In Rājagṛha, the thieves called ‘the scoundrels of the last autumn month’ have a custom: As soon as they have finished the rains retreat, they say, ‘Sirs, what work can we do that will provide us with a year’s livelihood without effort?’

original: longs spyod cing bde bar gnas par 'gyur zhes phan tshun gros byed do //
analyzed: longs spyod cing bde bar gnas par 'gyur zhes phan tshun gros byed do //
translated: They will enjoy themselves and live happily.”

original: de na dge slong gi rgyus shes pa zhig 'dug pa des smras pa /
analyzed: de na dge slong gi rgyus shes pa zhig 'dug pa des smras pa /
translated: A monk who knew the facts said,

original: shes ldan dag 'phags pa dag gi g-yog gang dag grong khyer gyi phyi rol na 'khod pa de dag gzhom par bya'o //
analyzed: shes ldan dag 'phags pa dag gi g-yog gang dag grong khyer gyi phyi rol na 'khod pa de dag gzhom par bya'o //
translated: “Sirs, let us destroy the attendants of the noble ones who are staying outside the city.”

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others said,

original: re zhig de dag gi jo bo gang dag yin pa de dag kyang sgo 'phar brgya snyed bzla ba byas kyang lto khengs pa 'grub par dka' bas de dag la yang cung zad kyang med na de dag gi g-yog de dag lta lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: re zhig de dag gi jo bo gang dag yin pa de dag kyang sgo 'phar brgya snyed bzla ba byas kyang lto khengs pa 'grub par dka' bas de dag la yang cung zad kyang med na de dag gi g-yog de dag lta lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: “It is difficult to fill the stomachs of those masters of theirs even if we break down a hundred doors. If they have nothing, what need is there to speak of their attendants?”

original: dge @146a *// slong gi rgyus shes pa des smras pa /
analyzed: dge @146a *// slong gi rgyus shes pa des smras pa /
translated: The monk who knew the facts said,

original: shes ldan dag khyed mi shes te /
analyzed: shes ldan dag khyed mi shes te /
translated: “Sirs, you do not know.

original: de dag ni zan gzhan las za zhing rang gi las rjes su bsgrub pa de lhur len te /
analyzed: de dag ni zan gzhan las za zhing rang gi las rjes su bsgrub pa de lhur len te /
translated: They eat the food of others and are devoted to their own work.

original: thabs du ma dag gis nor sgrub par byed pas de dag la gang yod pa de ni grong khyer 'di na yang med kyi cung zhig gzhom par bya'o //
analyzed: thabs du ma dag gis nor sgrub par byed pas de dag la gang yod pa de ni grong khyer 'di na yang med kyi cung zhig gzhom par bya'o //
translated: They acquire wealth through various means. What they have here in the city is not found anywhere else. We should destroy them a little.”

original: de dag gis brda byas te /
analyzed: de dag gis brda byas te /
translated: They made an agreement.

original: dong nas de dag gzhom par brtsams so //
analyzed: dong nas de dag gzhom par brtsams so //
translated: They went and began to destroy them.

original: de nas lha gang dag tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bu la mngon par dad pa de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha gang dag tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bu la mngon par dad pa de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then, the gods who had faith in the venerable Pilindavatsa said to the venerable Pilindavatsa,

original: 'phags pa mkhyen par mdzod cig /
analyzed: 'phags pa mkhyen par mdzod cig /
translated: “Noble one, please understand!

original: khyed kyi zham ring ba dag ston zla tha chung gi g-yon can dag gis 'joms par 'gyur gyis brtson par mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: khyed kyi zham ring ba dag ston zla tha chung gi g-yon can dag gis 'joms par 'gyur gyis brtson par mdzad du gsol /
translated: Your attendants are being destroyed by the rogues of the last month of autumn. Please be diligent!”

original: tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bus gal te g-yog dag la ma bsams na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bus gal te g-yog dag la ma bsams na /
translated: The venerable Pilindavatsa thought, “If I don’t think of my attendants,

original: g-yog dag kyang re zhig nor dang bral ba las byung ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: g-yog dag kyang re zhig nor dang bral ba las byung ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur la /
translated: my attendants will experience suffering that arises from being separated from their wealth.

original: ma dad pa rnams kyis kyang glags rnyed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ma dad pa rnams kyis kyang glags rnyed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Even the faithless will find an opportunity to criticize.

original: dad pa rnams kyang 'di ltar sbyin par bya ba'i chos byin pa dag yongs su skyong bar mi byed na /
analyzed: dad pa rnams kyang 'di ltar sbyin par bya ba'i chos byin pa dag yongs su skyong bar mi byed na /
translated: If those with faith see that the Dharma of generosity is not protected,

original: phyin chad su zhig sh'akya'i sras kyi dge sbyong rnams la sbyin pa dang bya bar sems zhes gzhan du gyur pa nyid du 'gyur gyis rdzu 'phrul rnam par bstan par bya'o snyam du bsams shing rig nas tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bus /
analyzed: phyin chad su zhig sh'akya'i sras kyi dge sbyong rnams la sbyin pa dang bya bar sems zhes gzhan du gyur pa nyid du 'gyur gyis rdzu 'phrul rnam par bstan par bya'o snyam du bsams shing rig nas tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bus /
translated: they will think, ‘In the future, who will think to give to the ascetics of the Śākya sage?’ They will turn away. Therefore, I will display my magical power.”

original: lha 'bangs kyi sdum pa de lcags kyi ra bas bskor to //
analyzed: lha 'bangs kyi sdum pa de lcags kyi ra bas bskor to //
translated: The venerable Pilindavatsa thought this and, knowing it, surrounded the house of Devadatta with an iron fence.

original: chom rkun pa dag gis rkun rdzas thogs te 'phags pa dang / lcags @146b kyi ra ba mthong nas /
analyzed: chom rkun pa dag gis rkun rdzas thogs te 'phags pa dang / lcags @146b kyi ra ba mthong nas /
translated: When the thieves came to steal, they saw the iron fence.

original: de dag gis phan tshun kun tu 'gro bar brtsams na lam ma rnyed do //
analyzed: de dag gis phan tshun kun tu 'gro bar brtsams na lam ma rnyed do //
translated: They tried to go around it, but could not find a way.

original: de dag gis rkun rdzas bor te 'phags pa dang lcags kyi ra ba de yang mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de dag gis rkun rdzas bor te 'phags pa dang lcags kyi ra ba de yang mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: They threw down their stolen goods, and the fence of the venerable one disappeared.

original: de dag gis yang rkun rdzas blangs pa dang / lcags kyi ra ba de yang yang phyir byung ste lan bdun gyi bar du de ltar gyur pa dang / de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis yang rkun rdzas blangs pa dang / lcags kyi ra ba de yang yang phyir byung ste lan bdun gyi bar du de ltar gyur pa dang / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: The thieves took the stolen goods and the iron fence returned to its original place. This happened seven times.

original: shes ldan dag 'phags pa rdzu 'phrul che ba mthu che ba 'ga' zhig gis 'di dag la dgongs pa 'dra'i rkun rdzas bor la 'bros par bya'o //
analyzed: shes ldan dag 'phags pa rdzu 'phrul che ba mthu che ba 'ga' zhig gis 'di dag la dgongs pa 'dra'i rkun rdzas bor la 'bros par bya'o //
translated: The thieves said, “Sirs, some noble one with great magical power and great might must have noticed this. Let’s abandon the stolen goods and run away.”

original: de dag gis rkun rdzas phyogs gcig tu bor te bros so //
analyzed: de dag gis rkun rdzas phyogs gcig tu bor te bros so //
translated: They abandoned the stolen goods in one place and ran away.

original: lha 'bangs de dag sad pa dang / shes ldan dag bdag cag bcom mo; ;bdag cag bcom mo zhes ku co 'don zhing de dag nor dang bral ba las byung ba'i yid mi bde ba dang ldan zhing thams cad 'dus nas /
analyzed: lha 'bangs de dag sad pa dang / shes ldan dag bdag cag bcom mo; ;bdag cag bcom mo zhes ku co 'don zhing de dag nor dang bral ba las byung ba'i yid mi bde ba dang ldan zhing thams cad 'dus nas /
translated: When the gods woke up, they cried out, “Sirs, we’ve been robbed! Sirs, we’ve been robbed!” They were unhappy because they had lost their wealth. They all gathered together

original: lha 'bangs kyi sdum pa kun tu byul bar brtsams pa dang; phyogs gcig na rdzas thams cad spungs te bzhag pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: lha 'bangs kyi sdum pa kun tu byul bar brtsams pa dang; phyogs gcig na rdzas thams cad spungs te bzhag pa mthong ngo //
translated: and searched everywhere in the gods’ houses. They saw all the stolen goods piled up in one place.

original: de nas dga' ba dang yid bde ba skyes te /
analyzed: de nas dga' ba dang yid bde ba skyes te /
translated: Then they were happy and felt relieved.

original: rang rang gi rdzas de blangs nas khyim khyim du dong ngo //
analyzed: rang rang gi rdzas de blangs nas khyim khyim du dong ngo //
translated: Taking their own goods, they went home.

original: de dag gis so so'i khyim srung ba bzhag ste /
analyzed: de dag gis so so'i khyim srung ba bzhag ste /
translated: They each set a guard at their house.

original: gnyid log pa na lha des de dag gi rmi lam du sbran pa /
analyzed: gnyid log pa na lha des de dag gi rmi lam du sbran pa /
translated: When they fell asleep, the god warned them in a dream:

original: shes ldan dag khyed cag ston zla tha chung gi g-yon can dag gis ma bcom pa 'di thams cad ni 'phags pa pi lin da'i bu'i mthu yin no //
analyzed: shes ldan dag khyed cag ston zla tha chung gi g-yon can dag gis ma bcom pa 'di thams cad ni 'phags pa pi lin da'i bu'i mthu yin no //
translated: “Sirs, all of this, that you have not been robbed by the rogues of the last month of autumn, is due to the power of the noble Pilindavatsa.”

original: de nas mtshan mo nam langs pa dang / thams cad 'dus te smras pa /🔽shes ldan dag lhas rmi lam du khyed cag ston zla tha chung gi g-yon can dag gis ma bcom @147a *//
analyzed: de nas mtshan mo nam langs pa dang / thams cad 'dus te smras pa / shes ldan dag lhas rmi lam du khyed cag ston zla tha chung gi g-yon can dag gis ma bcom @147a *//
translated: Then, when night had passed, they all gathered together and said,🔽“Sirs, the god warned us in a dream:

original: pa 'di dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: pa 'di dag thams cad ni /
translated: ‘All of this, that you have not been robbed by the rogues of the last month of autumn,

original: 'phags pa pi lin da'i bu'i mthu yin no zhes bstan te /
analyzed: 'phags pa pi lin da'i bu'i mthu yin no zhes bstan te /
translated: is due to the power of the noble Pilindavatsa.’🔽That is exactly what happened.

original: de ni de kho na bzhin yin gyi gzhan du na 'phags pa pi lin da'i bu ma gtogs pa gzhan su zhig bdag cag la snying rje bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni de kho na bzhin yin gyi gzhan du na 'phags pa pi lin da'i bu ma gtogs pa gzhan su zhig bdag cag la snying rje bar 'gyur /
translated: Except for the noble Pilindavatsa, who else would have compassion for us?”

original: de'i tshe de dag byi dor byas la phyis gtsug lag khang du 'dong zhes de dag khrus byas shing gos dkar po dang dri dang phreng ba brgyus brgyan te; byi dor byas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag byi dor byas la phyis gtsug lag khang du 'dong zhes de dag khrus byas shing gos dkar po dang dri dang phreng ba brgyus brgyan te; byi dor byas te /
translated: “We will clean them and then go to the monastery.” They bathed, put on white clothes, and adorned themselves with garlands and perfumes.

original: gtsug lag khang du dong ngo //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du dong ngo //
translated: They cleaned themselves and then went to the monastery.

original: nye dga' yang nang par sngar langs nas lde mig dang lde mig kyog po thogs nas /
analyzed: nye dga' yang nang par sngar langs nas lde mig dang lde mig kyog po thogs nas /
translated: Upāli got up early in the morning, took the keys and the key ring,

original: gtsug lag khang gi sgo phye ste mar me'i kong bu bsal nas /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi sgo phye ste mar me'i kong bu bsal nas /
translated: opened the door of the monastery,

original: gtsug lag khang du chag chag dang byug pa byas te gnas mal bshams nas /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du chag chag dang byug pa byas te gnas mal bshams nas /
translated: swept the monastery, anointed it, arranged the seats,

original: mchod rten gyi 'khor sar bdug spos brims nas /
analyzed: mchod rten gyi 'khor sar bdug spos brims nas /
translated: put incense in the incense burners,

original: khang steng du 'dzegs te gand'i rdung zhing phyogs bzhir rnam par blta'o //
analyzed: khang steng du 'dzegs te gand'i rdung zhing phyogs bzhir rnam par blta'o //
translated: climbed up to the roof, rang the gong, and looked in the four directions.

original: des de dag gos dkar po dang dri dang phreng ba brgyus brgyan pa mthong nas /🔽de 'di dag nor can dag gam /
analyzed: des de dag gos dkar po dang dri dang phreng ba brgyus brgyan pa mthong nas / de 'di dag nor can dag gam /
translated: He saw that they were wearing white clothes, adorned with garlands and perfumes.🔽“Are they rich people?

original: tshong dpon dag gam /
analyzed: tshong dpon dag gam /
translated: Are they guild masters?

original: ded dpon gtsug lag khang ltar 'ong ba su zhig yin snyam du sems so //
analyzed: ded dpon gtsug lag khang ltar 'ong ba su zhig yin snyam du sems so //
translated: Who could be coming like a caravan to the monastery?”

original: gang gi tshe mchod rten gyi 'khor sar zhugs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mchod rten gyi 'khor sar zhugs pa de'i tshe /
translated: When they entered the courtyard of the stūpa,

original: des de dag ngo shes nas /
analyzed: des de dag ngo shes nas /
translated: they recognized them.

original: nye dgas gshe zhing smras pa /
analyzed: nye dgas gshe zhing smras pa /
translated: Upāli scolded them, saying,

original: ngas khyed cag la sang nang bar sngar shog cig ces ma bsgo 'am /
analyzed: ngas khyed cag la sang nang bar sngar shog cig ces ma bsgo 'am /
translated: “Didn’t I tell you to come in the morning?”

original: khyed gar dong dong /
analyzed: khyed gar dong dong /
translated: “Where did you go?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: 'phags pa gal te bdag cag la 'phags pa pi lin da'i bus ma dgongs su lags na /
analyzed: 'phags pa gal te bdag cag la 'phags pa pi lin da'i bus ma dgongs su lags na /
translated: “Noble one, if the noble Pilindavatsa had not forgotten us,

original: @147b bdag cag deng kho nar ston zla tha chung gi g-yon can dag gis tshul ma lags pas sdug bsngal bsgrubs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @147b bdag cag deng kho nar ston zla tha chung gi g-yon can dag gis tshul ma lags pas sdug bsngal bsgrubs par 'gyur ro //
translated: today we would have been tormented by the deceit of the wicked in the last month of summer.”

original: nye dgas gshe zhing smras pa /
analyzed: nye dgas gshe zhing smras pa /
translated: Upāli scolded them, saying,

original: khyed cag re zhig gang gi mthus snyem pa de la yang je khrims bca' bar bya'o zhes rig nas drug sde dag sbran te /
analyzed: khyed cag re zhig gang gi mthus snyem pa de la yang je khrims bca' bar bya'o zhes rig nas drug sde dag sbran te /
translated: “First, I will make a rule for those who are proud because of their power.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bu ga la ba der song nas phyin pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bu ga la ba der song nas phyin pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa pi lin da'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He went to the venerable Pilindavatsa and said,

original: gnas brtan la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gnas brtan la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: “I pay homage to the elder.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag aa rog gya /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag aa rog gya /
translated: “Venerable ones, what is it?”

original: gnas brtan je skabs phye shig /
analyzed: gnas brtan je skabs phye shig /
translated: “Elder, please give us an opportunity.”

original: ltung ba sde lnga po dag la skabs phye'o //
analyzed: ltung ba sde lnga po dag la skabs phye'o //
translated: “I give you an opportunity regarding the five classes of offenses.”

original: gnas brtan gyis zham ring ba dag gi nor ston zla tha chung gi g-yon can dag gis brkus pa thar par bgyis sam /
analyzed: gnas brtan gyis zham ring ba dag gi nor ston zla tha chung gi g-yon can dag gis brkus pa thar par bgyis sam /
translated: “Elder, did you free the thieves who stole the wealth of the attendants during the month of Phālguna?”

original: de bzhin ta thar bar byas so //
analyzed: de bzhin ta thar bar byas so //
translated: “I did free them.”

original: gnas brtan bdag cag gis gnas brtan go bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dag gi bde ba nyams su myong bar mdzad cing bzhugs par 'tshal gyis /
analyzed: gnas brtan bdag cag gis gnas brtan go bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dag gi bde ba nyams su myong bar mdzad cing bzhugs par 'tshal gyis /
translated: “Elder, we wish that you would remain experiencing the bliss of concentration, liberation, absorption, and equipoise.

original: bdag cag gis thugs rje phyogs gcig pa dang ldan zhing zham ring ba dag la thugs rje bar mdzad la /
analyzed: bdag cag gis thugs rje phyogs gcig pa dang ldan zhing zham ring ba dag la thugs rje bar mdzad la /
translated: We wish that you would have compassion for us, your attendants, who are one-sided in our compassion.”

original: ston zla tha chung gi g-yon can dag la mi mdzad par ma 'tshal te /
analyzed: ston zla tha chung gi g-yon can dag la mi mdzad par ma 'tshal te /
translated: I do not think that this is the case for the dishonest people of the last autumn month.

original: dge slong dag de'i tshe de'i dus kyis rngon pa gang yin pa de ni nye sde 'di yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag de'i tshe de'i dus kyis rngon pa gang yin pa de ni nye sde 'di yin te /
translated: “Monks, the one who was the hunter then is Saṅgharakṣita.

original: des rang sangs rgyas kyi gnad du mda' dug can gyi bsnun pa gang yin pa'i las de'i rnam par smin pas bskal par sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med par gdungs nas /
analyzed: des rang sangs rgyas kyi gnad du mda' dug can gyi bsnun pa gang yin pa'i las de'i rnam par smin pas bskal par sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med par gdungs nas /
translated: The act of shooting a poisoned arrow into the vital point of a solitary buddha ripened such that he was tormented in the great Avīci hell for an eon.

original: las de nyid kyi lhag mas tshe rabs lnga brgyar dug gis dus la bab ste /
analyzed: las de nyid kyi lhag mas tshe rabs lnga brgyar dug gis dus la bab ste /
translated: The remainder of that karma ripened such that he died of poison in five hundred lifetimes.

original: da ltar gyi bar du yang dgra @180a *//
analyzed: da ltar gyi bar du yang dgra @180a *//
translated: And now, too, he was killed by an enemy🔽with poison.

original: bcom pa thob kyang /
analyzed: bcom pa thob kyang /
translated: He attained arhatship.

original: de dug gis yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: de dug gis yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: He passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: mchod pa byas nas smon lam btab pa gang yin pa des ni da ltar phyug pa nor mang ba longs spyod che ba'i khyim du gzugs bzang ba lta na sdug pa mdzes par skyes shing /🔽nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas /
analyzed: mchod pa byas nas smon lam btab pa gang yin pa des ni da ltar phyug pa nor mang ba longs spyod che ba'i khyim du gzugs bzang ba lta na sdug pa mdzes par skyes shing / nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas /
translated: Because of the prayers he made after making offerings, he was born into a family of great means, prosperity, and wealth, and was well proportioned, pleasing to the eye, and beautiful.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byas shing /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byas shing /
translated: He went forth in my very doctrine, cast away all afflictive emotions, and manifested arhatship.🔽He pleased me, and did not displease me.

original: 'dis rang sangs rgyas bye ba phrag 'bum pas ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i ston pa nga mnyes par byas shing thugs byung bar ma byas so //
analyzed: 'dis rang sangs rgyas bye ba phrag 'bum pas ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i ston pa nga mnyes par byas shing thugs byung bar ma byas so //
translated: He was a teacher who was a hundred thousand times more exalted than a hundred thousand pratyekabuddhas.

original: dge slong dag de ltar na las gcig tu gnag pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ni gcig tu gnag pa yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dag de ltar na las gcig tu gnag pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ni gcig tu gnag pa yin la /
translated: “Thus, bhikṣus, the ripening of entirely negative actions is entirely negative,🔽the ripening of entirely positive actions is entirely positive,

original: las gcig tu dkar ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yang gcig tu dkar ba yin /
analyzed: las gcig tu dkar ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yang gcig tu dkar ba yin /
translated: and the ripening of mixed actions is mixed.

original: las 'dren ma rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yang 'dren ma yin no //
analyzed: las 'dren ma rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yang 'dren ma yin no //
translated: The ripening of mixed karma is mixed.

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na las gcig tu gnag pa rnams dang 'dren ma rnams spangs te /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na las gcig tu gnag pa rnams dang 'dren ma rnams spangs te /
translated: “Therefore, monks, you should abandon entirely black and mixed karma.

original: las gcig tu dkar ba rnams la brtsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: las gcig tu dkar ba rnams la brtsal bar bya ste /
translated: You should strive for entirely white karma.

original: dge slong dag khyed kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: Monks, you should train in this way.”

original: 'di yang re zhig byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di yang re zhig byung ba yin gyi /
translated: “This is also a matter that has arisen.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed Buddha, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, does not lay down a rule for the training of the disciples in the Vinaya of the Blessed Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying at Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: mnyan yod na tshong dpon zhig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs te /🔽de de dang lhan cig @180b rtse bar byed /🔽dga' bar byed /
analyzed: mnyan yod na tshong dpon zhig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs te / de de dang lhan cig @180b rtse bar byed / dga' bar byed /
translated: In Śrāvastī there was a certain merchant. He took a wife from a family of equal rank.🔽He enjoyed himself with her,🔽took pleasure with her,

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: and coupled with her.

original: rtse bar byed dga' bar byed dga' mgur spyod par byed pa de la bu btsas nas /🔽de btsas pa'i rim gyis rigs dang mthun pa'i ming btags te /
analyzed: rtse bar byed dga' bar byed dga' mgur spyod par byed pa de la bu btsas nas / de btsas pa'i rim gyis rigs dang mthun pa'i ming btags te /
translated: A son was born to them.

original: de bsrings shing bskyed nas chen por gyur to //
analyzed: de bsrings shing bskyed nas chen por gyur to //
translated: They raised him and he grew up.

original: ji tsam na tshong dpon de'i chung ma dus la bab nas /
analyzed: ji tsam na tshong dpon de'i chung ma dus la bab nas /
translated: Then, when the merchant’s wife died,

original: des chung ma gzhan zhig blangs te /
analyzed: des chung ma gzhan zhig blangs te /
translated: he took another wife.

original: tshong dpon des chung ma de la smras pa bzang mo gzhan las skyes pas ni bya ba byed par nus kyi mi mthun par skyes pas ni mi nus pas /
analyzed: tshong dpon des chung ma de la smras pa bzang mo gzhan las skyes pas ni bya ba byed par nus kyi mi mthun par skyes pas ni mi nus pas /
translated: The merchant said to his wife, “Good woman, a son born of another woman can do what needs to be done, but one born of an unsympathetic woman cannot.

original: khye'u 'di khyod kyi bu yin gyis /
analyzed: khye'u 'di khyod kyi bu yin gyis /
translated: This boy is your son.

original: khyod kyis 'di la mkho ba bstab par bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'di la mkho ba bstab par bya'o //
translated: You must provide for his needs.”

original: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na chung ma gnyis pa de la yang sems can zhugs par gyur nas /
analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na chung ma gnyis pa de la yang sems can zhugs par gyur nas /
translated: Later, the second wife became pregnant.

original: des bsams ba /
analyzed: des bsams ba /
translated: She thought,

original: bdag la yang bu yod par gyur pas khye'u 'di de'i zla bor 'gyur gyis 'di bstod par mi bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: bdag la yang bu yod par gyur pas khye'u 'di de'i zla bor 'gyur gyis 'di bstod par mi bya'o snyam nas /
translated: “Since I will have a son, this boy will be his companion. I will not praise him.”

original: des khye'u de zas ngan pa dang / gos ngan pa bsrel du 'jug cing khu tshur dang thal lcag dag gis kyang yang dang yang du rdeg par byed do //
analyzed: des khye'u de zas ngan pa dang / gos ngan pa bsrel du 'jug cing khu tshur dang thal lcag dag gis kyang yang dang yang du rdeg par byed do //
translated: She also beat him again and again with her fists and slaps.

original: khye'u de pha'i gan du song ste smras pa /
analyzed: khye'u de pha'i gan du song ste smras pa /
translated: The boy went to his father and said,

original: yab bdag la ma yar mo 'dis zas ngan pa dang / gos ngan pa bsrel du stsol cing /
analyzed: yab bdag la ma yar mo 'dis zas ngan pa dang / gos ngan pa bsrel du stsol cing /
translated: “Father, this stepmother of mine makes me eat bad food and wear bad clothes.

original: khu tshur dang thal lcag dag gis kyang yang dang yang du rdeg par bgyid do //
analyzed: khu tshur dang thal lcag dag gis kyang yang dang yang du rdeg par bgyid do //
translated: She also beats me again and again with her fists and slaps.”

original: tshong dpon des smras pa /
analyzed: tshong dpon des smras pa /
translated: The merchant said,

original: bu ci nas kyang phyin chad de ltar mi byed par bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: bu ci nas kyang phyin chad de ltar mi byed par bzlog par bya'o //
translated: “Son, I will stop her from doing that to you from now on.”

original: tshong dpon des chung ma la smras pa /
analyzed: tshong dpon des chung ma la smras pa /
translated: The merchant said to his wife,

original: bzang mo kho bos khyod la dang po nyid nas gzhan las skyes pas ni bya ba byed par nus kyis /
analyzed: bzang mo kho bos khyod la dang po nyid nas gzhan las skyes pas ni bya ba byed par nus kyis /
translated: “Bhadratī, didn’t I tell you from the beginning that one born of another can do the work,

original: mi mthun par skyes pas ni @181a *//
analyzed: mi mthun par skyes pas ni @181a *//
translated: but one born of someone who is not related cannot?

original: mi nus pas khye'u 'di khyod kyi bu yin gyis khyod kyis 'di la mkho ba bstab par bya'o zhes ma smras sam /
analyzed: mi nus pas khye'u 'di khyod kyi bu yin gyis khyod kyis 'di la mkho ba bstab par bya'o zhes ma smras sam /
translated: ‘This boy is your son. You must provide for him.’”

original: ci'i phyir khyod kyis 'di la zas ngan pa dang / gos ngan pa bsrel du 'jud cing /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khyod kyis 'di la zas ngan pa dang / gos ngan pa bsrel du 'jud cing /
translated: Why do you make him wear poor clothes and eat poor food?

original: khu tshur dang thal lcag dag gis kyang yang dang yang du rdeg par byed /
analyzed: khu tshur dang thal lcag dag gis kyang yang dang yang du rdeg par byed /
translated: And why do you beat him again and again with your fists and slaps?”

original: chung mas smras pa /
analyzed: chung mas smras pa /
translated: His wife said,

original: rje'i sras bdag gis 'di bslab par bgyi ste /
analyzed: rje'i sras bdag gis 'di bslab par bgyi ste /
translated: “Lord, I am teaching him.

original: 'di ni tshong dpon gyi bu lags pas /
analyzed: 'di ni tshong dpon gyi bu lags pas /
translated: He is the son of a merchant.

original: gal te ma bslabs na rje'i sras nyid la yang 'jig rten dag nges par smod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma bslabs na rje'i sras nyid la yang 'jig rten dag nges par smod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If I do not teach him, lord, the people of the world will certainly criticize you.”

original: tshong dpon gyis smras pa /
analyzed: tshong dpon gyis smras pa /
translated: The merchant said,

original: khyod 'di slob par ma bskos kyis /
analyzed: khyod 'di slob par ma bskos kyis /
translated: “You were not appointed to teach him.

original: phyin chad 'di zas ngan pa dang gos ngan pa bsrel du mi gzhug cing /
analyzed: phyin chad 'di zas ngan pa dang gos ngan pa bsrel du mi gzhug cing /
translated: From now on, do not make him wear poor clothes and eat poor food.

original: khu tshur dang thal lcag gis yang dang yang du ma rdegs shig /
analyzed: khu tshur dang thal lcag gis yang dang yang du ma rdegs shig /
translated: And do not beat him again and again with your fists and slaps.”

original: chung ma de tshong dpon de'i shin tu gnang chen yin pas /
analyzed: chung ma de tshong dpon de'i shin tu gnang chen yin pas /
translated: Because that wife was very dear to the merchant,

original: chung ma des khye'u de phyir zhing shas cher gos ngan pa dang / zas ngan pa bsrel du 'jud cing /
analyzed: chung ma des khye'u de phyir zhing shas cher gos ngan pa dang / zas ngan pa bsrel du 'jud cing /
translated: that wife made the boy wear even poorer clothes and eat even poorer food.

original: khu tshur dang thal lcag gis kyang yang dang yang du rdeg par byed do //
analyzed: khu tshur dang thal lcag gis kyang yang dang yang du rdeg par byed do //
translated: He also hit him again and again with his fists and slaps.

original: khye'u des bsams pa /
analyzed: khye'u des bsams pa /
translated: The young man thought,

original: bdag gi phas ma yar mo 'di drag tu ma bzlog pas /
analyzed: bdag gi phas ma yar mo 'di drag tu ma bzlog pas /
translated: My father did not stop my mother from doing this.

original: des na ma yar mo 'di bdag la phyir zhing shas cher zas ngan pa dang / gos ngan pa bsrel du 'jud cing /
analyzed: des na ma yar mo 'di bdag la phyir zhing shas cher zas ngan pa dang / gos ngan pa bsrel du 'jud cing /
translated: Therefore, this mother of mine makes me eat bad food and wear bad clothes,

original: khu tshur dang thal lcag dag gis kyang yang dang yang du rdeg par byed kyis bdag rab tu 'byung du 'gro'o snyam nas /
analyzed: khu tshur dang thal lcag dag gis kyang yang dang yang du rdeg par byed kyis bdag rab tu 'byung du 'gro'o snyam nas /
translated: and also hits me again and again with her fists and slaps. I will go forth.🔽The young man said to his father, Father, you did not stop my mother from doing this.

original: khye'u des pha la yab khyod kyis bdag gi ma yar mo 'di bzlog kyang 'dis slar zhing shas cher bdag zas ngan pa dang gos ngan pa bsrel du @181b du stsal cing /
analyzed: khye'u des pha la yab khyod kyis bdag gi ma yar mo 'di bzlog kyang 'dis slar zhing shas cher bdag zas ngan pa dang gos ngan pa bsrel du @181b du stsal cing /
translated: Therefore, this mother of mine makes me eat bad food and wear bad clothes,

original: khu tshur dang thal lcag dag gis kyang yang dang yang du rdeg par bgyid kyis bdag rab tu 'byung du mchi'o zhes ci nas cir brgyud de gsol ba byas so //
analyzed: khu tshur dang thal lcag dag gis kyang yang dang yang du rdeg par bgyid kyis bdag rab tu 'byung du mchi'o zhes ci nas cir brgyud de gsol ba byas so //
translated: and also hits me again and again with her fists and slaps. I will go forth. He made his request in this way.

original: tshong dpon de chung ma de la ha cad byams shing de'i sems srung bas /
analyzed: tshong dpon de chung ma de la ha cad byams shing de'i sems srung bas /
translated: The merchant loved his wife and wanted to protect her.

original: de drag tu bzlog par ma nus nas /
analyzed: de drag tu bzlog par ma nus nas /
translated: He was unable to stop her.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: bu khyim bdag gi chung ma 'di gtum pa brtun ngas pa drag shul che ba yin gyis song la rab tu byung zhig dang khyod gson pa mthong bar yang 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bu khyim bdag gi chung ma 'di gtum pa brtun ngas pa drag shul che ba yin gyis song la rab tu byung zhig dang khyod gson pa mthong bar yang 'gyur gyi /
translated: “Son, this wife of the householder is fierce, strong, and violent. Go forth. You will see me alive.

original: gal te na khyod la gnod pa byed par 'gyur ba'i gnas kyang yod do //
analyzed: gal te na khyod la gnod pa byed par 'gyur ba'i gnas kyang yod do //
translated: But there is a possibility that she will harm you.”

original: khye'u de phas gnang nas rgyal byed kyi tshal du song ste /
analyzed: khye'u de phas gnang nas rgyal byed kyi tshal du song ste /
translated: The young man was allowed to go by his father. He went to the Jetavana.

original: dge slong gi drung du song nas rkang pa gnyis la phyag 'tshal te smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong gi drung du song nas rkang pa gnyis la phyag 'tshal te smras pa /
translated: He went to a monk, bowed down at his feet, and said,

original: 'phags pa bdag rab tu 'byung bar 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa bdag rab tu 'byung bar 'tshal lo //
translated: “Noble one, I wish to go forth.”

original: dge slong des smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong des smras pa /
translated: The monk said,

original: bzhin bzang khyod kyis sems bskyed pa legs te /
analyzed: bzhin bzang khyod kyis sems bskyed pa legs te /
translated: “Good son, it is excellent that you have developed the intention.

original: longs spyod dag ni 'gyur ba yin gyis rab tu byung zhig /
analyzed: longs spyod dag ni 'gyur ba yin gyis rab tu byung zhig /
translated: Since enjoyments change, go forth.”

original: dge slong des khye'u de rab tu phyung rdzogs par bsnyen par byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong des khye'u de rab tu phyung rdzogs par bsnyen par byas nas smras pa /
translated: The monk gave him the going forth and the full ordination, and said,

original: bzhin bzang dge slong gi las ni gnyis te /
analyzed: bzhin bzang dge slong gi las ni gnyis te /
translated: “My son, a monk’s work is twofold:

original: bsam gtan dang / klog pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / klog pa yin no //
translated: meditation and recitation.”

original: kho bo ni bsam gtan pa yin na /
analyzed: kho bo ni bsam gtan pa yin na /
translated: “I am a meditator.

original: khyod bsam gtan dang / klog pa gang byed /
analyzed: khyod bsam gtan dang / klog pa gang byed /
translated: Which will you do, meditation or recitation?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He replied,

original: mkhan po klog pa'o //
analyzed: mkhan po klog pa'o //
translated: “Preceptor, I will recite.”

original: bu legs kyis khyod kyis sde snod gsum po dag bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: bu legs kyis khyod kyis sde snod gsum po dag bklag par bya'o //
translated: “Son, that is excellent. You should recite the Tripiṭaka.”

original: des bsams pa /
analyzed: des bsams pa /
translated: He thought,

original: gzhung ma la mkhan po rjes su bsrung dgos pas 'di na bdag la klog tu 'jud pa med kyis /
analyzed: gzhung ma la mkhan po rjes su bsrung dgos pas 'di na bdag la klog tu 'jud pa med kyis /
translated: “I must please my preceptor, but I have no one to make me recite here.🔽I will go to another country.”

original: yul gzhan du 'gro'o snyam nas de yul gzhan du song ngo //
analyzed: yul gzhan du 'gro'o snyam nas de yul gzhan du song ngo //
translated: He went to another country.

original: des der sde @182a *//🔽snod gsum po dag bklags shing sde snod gsum dang ldan pa chos sgrogs pa /
analyzed: des der sde @182a *// snod gsum po dag bklags shing sde snod gsum dang ldan pa chos sgrogs pa /
translated: There he recited the Tripiṭaka.

original: rig pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa can du gyur to //
analyzed: rig pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa can du gyur to //
translated: He became a dharma preacher who knew the Tripiṭaka, and he became eloquent with the eloquence of knowledge and freedom.🔽He thought,

original: des bsams pa /
analyzed: des bsams pa /
translated: He thought,🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag bu'i pha ma snyod par byed pa /🔽gso bar byed pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag bu'i pha ma snyod par byed pa / gso bar byed pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks, there are two parents of a child who feed it,🔽nurture it,

original: skyed par byed pa /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa /
translated: raise it,

original: nu ma snun par byed pa /
analyzed: nu ma snun par byed pa /
translated: and nurse it at the breast.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling sna tshogs ston par byed pa gnyis ni dka' ba byed pa dag yin te /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling sna tshogs ston par byed pa gnyis ni dka' ba byed pa dag yin te /
translated: They show the child the various things in the world.

original: bus phrag pa gcig gis ni pha /
analyzed: bus phrag pa gcig gis ni pha /
translated: They are the child’s father on one shoulder and its mother on the other.

original: cig shos kyis ni ma lo brgya tham par yongs su pang ba byas sam /
analyzed: cig shos kyis ni ma lo brgya tham par yongs su pang ba byas sam /
translated: For a hundred years the child carries them on its shoulders.

original: sa chen po 'dir nor bu dang / mu tig dang / beed'ur++ya dang / man shel dkar po dang / byi ru dang / dngul dang / sa le sbram dang / rdo'i snying po dang / spug dang / dmar po dang / g-yas su 'khyil dang /🔽de lta bu'i dbang phyug gi bdag po la bkod par gyur pa gang yin pa de tsam gyis ni bus pha ma gnyis la byas pa dang / nye bar byas par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sa chen po 'dir nor bu dang / mu tig dang / beed'ur++ya dang / man shel dkar po dang / byi ru dang / dngul dang / sa le sbram dang / rdo'i snying po dang / spug dang / dmar po dang / g-yas su 'khyil dang / de lta bu'i dbang phyug gi bdag po la bkod par gyur pa gang yin pa de tsam gyis ni bus pha ma gnyis la byas pa dang / nye bar byas par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Or, if it were to fill this great earth with jewels, pearls, beryl, white shells, coral, silver, gold, emeralds, white amber, and right-spiraling conches,🔽it would not be enough to repay its parents.

original: de pha ma ma dad pa gnyis dad pa phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: de pha ma ma dad pa gnyis dad pa phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: If the child’s parents are not faithful, it should make them perfect in faith.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bjud  'dul bar byed /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bjud  'dul bar byed /
translated: He causes them to take it up, he disciplines them,

original: 'dzud par byed /
analyzed: 'dzud par byed /
translated: he makes them enter,

original: rab tu 'god par byed /
analyzed: rab tu 'god par byed /
translated: he establishes them.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa gnyis tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / ser sna can gnyis gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / shes rab 'chal ba gnyis shes rab phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jud /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa gnyis tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / ser sna can gnyis gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / shes rab 'chal ba gnyis shes rab phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jud /
translated: He causes the two with faulty discipline to have perfect discipline, the two with stinginess to have perfect generosity, and the two with faulty wisdom to have perfect wisdom.

original: 'dul bar byed /🔽'dzud par byed /
analyzed: 'dul bar byed / 'dzud par byed /
translated: He disciplines them,🔽he makes them enter,

original: rab tu 'god par byed na /
analyzed: rab tu 'god par byed na /
translated: he establishes them.
